gurmukhi: ਤਰੁਵਰੁ ਗਿਰੇ ਪਾਤ ਬਹੁਰੋ ਨ ਜੋਰੇ ਜਾਤ ਅੈਸੋ ਤਾਤ ਮਾਤ ਸੁਤ ਭ੍ਰਾਤ ਮੋਹ ਮਾਯਾ ਕੋ
transliteration: Taruvaru Giray Paat Bahuro N Joray Jaata , Aiso Taat Maat Sout Bhraat Moh Maayaa Ko ?
translation: Just as leaves broken from the branches of a tree cannot be re-attached, similarly; father, mother, son, brother are relations that came into being due to chance of previous births. Like the leaves of a tree they will not re-unite again. None of these wil

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਬੁਦਬੁਦਾ ਓਰਾ ਪੇਖਤ ਬਿਲਾੲਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਅੈਸੋ ਜਾਨ ਤ੍ਰਯਾਗਹੁ ਭਰੋਸੇ ਭ੍ਰਮ ਕਾਯਾ ਕੋ
transliteration: Jaisay Budabudaa Aoraa Paykhat Bilaai Jaai , Aiso Jaan Tyaagahu Bharosay Bhram Kaayaa Ko ?
translation: Just as a bubble of water and a hail perishes in no time, similarly, give up the belief and illusion that this body will stay for long or forever.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰਿਣ ਕੀ ਅਗਨਿ ਜਰਿ ਬੂਝਤ ਨਬਾਰ ਲਾਗੈ ਅੈਸੀ ਅਾਵਾ ਅੌਧਿ ਜੈਸੇ ਨੇਹੁ ਦ੍ਰੁਮ ਛਾਯਾ ਕੋ
transliteration: Trin Kee Agani Jari Boojhat Nabaar Laagai , Aisee Aavaa Audhi Jaisay Nayhu Droum Chhaayaa Ko ?
translation: The fire of hay takes no time to extinguish, and just as developing attachment with the shade of a tree is futile, so is the period of our life. Loving it is worthless.

gurmukhi: ਜਨਮ ਜੀਵਨ ਅੰਤਕਾਲ ਕੇ ਸੰਗਾਤੀ ਰਾਚਹੁ ਸਫਲ ਅੌਸਰ ਜਗ ਤਬ ਹੀ ਤੳੁ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਕੋ ॥੫੯੨॥
transliteration: Janam Jeevan Antakaal Kay Sangaatee Raachahu , Sadhal Aousar Jag Tab Hee Tau Aaiaa Ko ?592?
translation: Therefore, absorb yourself in the Naam of the True Lord throughout your life-span since this is the only asset that will go with you and is the companion for ever. Only then should you consider your birth in this world a success.
